snippet: A new government study found that about 60 percent of teenage girls who have sex use the most effective kinds of contraception, including the pill and the patch.
abstract: Study by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention finds that about 60 percent of teenage girls who have sex use the most effective kinds of contraception, a significant increase from the 1990s.
lead_paragraph: A new government study found that about 60 percent of teenage girls who have sex use the most effective kinds of contraception, including the pill and the patch.

headline.main: Georgia: Study Finds Teenage Girls Are Using Better Birth Control
headline.print_headline: Georgia: Study Finds Teenage Girls Are Using Better Birth Control

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
